intro: Clematis florida var. normalis, commonly known as the Japanese clematis, is a deciduous vine native to East Asia. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring. The plant has compound leaves with three to five leaflets and produces small, green berries that mature to black. It thrives in partial shade to full sun and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
